metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16231 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
drivers/net/fjes/fjes_main.c in the Linux kernel 5.2.14 does not check the alloc_workqueue return value, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. It was discovered that the Fujitsu ES network device driver for the Linux kernel did not properly check for errors in some situations, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16231` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-210-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.4.0-210-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.4.0-210-lowlatency - 4.4.0-207.239

linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-210-lowlatency - 4.4.0-207.239
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-207.239').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.140').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1').

linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.100').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1150.161').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-207.239').
